description: President Biden's campaign will mobilize voters on the issue of abortion to mark two years since the Supreme Court's decision overturning Roe v. Wade.
title: Haris, Jill Biden to travel to battleground states to mark Dobbs ruling

description: In this episode of “Climate Watch: Protecting the Planet,” CBS News senior environmental correspondent Ben Tracy explores the cutting-edge technology some businesses are using to lessen carbon dioxide and methane emissions.
title: Climate Watch: Protecting the Planet | How some U.S. businesses are helping reduce greenhouse gasses

description: Dangerous heat wave brings scorching temperatures across the country; The Decemberists' lead singer talks new album and upcoming world tour.
title: 6/22: Saturday Morning

description: The longtime TV host, who died in 2020 after a battle with pancreatic cancer, is being remembered with a new Forever stamp by the United States Postal Service.
title: Late "Jeopardy!" host Alex Trebek to be honored with new Forever stamp

description: Former president Donald Trump will address politically influential evangelicals at the Faith & Freedom Coalition in Washington D.C..
title: Trump will address influential evangelicals who back his candidacy

description: With planet-warming carbon dioxide levels the highest they've been in millions of years, many farmers say record-breaking high temperatures are affecting their crops. One farmer is taking part in an unusual experiment to try and cut carbon emissions while improving his soil and crops.
title: Farmer takes part in unusual experiment to help farm thrive amid rising temperatures

description: Louisiana this week passed a controversial law requiring the Ten Commandments be displayed in every public school classroom in the state.
title: Trump backs Louisiana law requiring Ten Commandments in schools

description: Spend the weekend with NASCAR. Find out how to watch today's Ambetter Health 200 NASCAR race.
title: How to watch the Ambetter Health 200 NASCAR race today

description: The lawyer for one of Iran's popular hip-hop artists and a critic of the regime Toomaj Salehi says the country's Supreme Court has overturned his death sentence.
title: Iran overturns the death sentence of rapper charged in relation to protests

description: Lukas McClish, 34, was reported missing by his family on June 11. He was found on June 20.
title: California man missing for more than a week found alive

description: Diners are a staple of New Jersey, and at one establishment, owner John Diakakis doesn't let his blindness stop him from serving up delicious food and a welcoming atmosphere.
title: Blind diner owner serves up comfort fare and comedy

description: In Michigan, we hear from a group of women from Jewish and Palestinian backgrounds working to build conversation and community in order to bridge a cultural divide. Then in Maryland, we meet some of the surviving, real-life Rosie the Riveters who changed the workforce forever. Watch these stories and more on Eye on America with host Michelle Miller.
title: Eye on America: Rosie the Riveters honored and an unlikely group’s healing conversations

description: Violence has flared in the West Bank since the Israel-Hamas war erupted last October.
title: Israeli found dead after being shot in West Bank as deadly strikes hit Gaza

description: This week, the nation commemorated Juneteenth, which recognizes the end of slavery in the United States. For many African-American families, it can be a challenge to trace their lineage, but one Virginia family fought and found a way. Now, their family tree is on display at the nation's oldest cultural institution: The Library of Congress.
title: A family fought to trace its family tree. Now, it is being shown at the Library of Congress

description: A Supreme Court ruling that could impact dozens, if not hundreds, of Jan. 6 convictions — and possibly upend some criminal charges against former President Donald Trump — is still ahead. The court will decide if a federal obstruction law used to charge some rioters was misused by prosecutors. Meanwhile, a review by CBS News found that taxpayers are still footing most of the bill for repairing damage caused by the attack.
title: Taxpayers continue to foot the bill for Jan. 6 attack, CBS News finds; SCOTUS decision looms

description: For nearly 25 years, the Decemberists have captured listeners with their unique, highly stylized songs. Now, the group is out with their first album in six years and preparing for a world tour. From their new album "As It Ever Was, So It Will Be Again," here are the Decemberists with "Burial Ground."
title: Saturday Sessions: The Decemberists perform "Burial Ground"

description: Justin Timberlake spoke about his recent arrest on D.W.I. charges while performing in Chicago as part of his world tour.
title: Justin Timberlake breaks his silence at tour stop: "It's been a tough week"

description: A ghostwriter forms an unlikely friendship with an 86-year-old man while recording his life story. A young athlete suffers a life-changing injury, but instead of letting it end his athletic career, he decides to find a way to adapt. Plus more heartwarming news.
title: The Uplift: An unlikely friendship

description: For nearly 25 years, the Decemberists have captured listeners with their unique, highly stylized songs. Now, the group is out with their first album in six years and preparing for a world tour. From their new album "As It Ever Was, So It Will Be Again," here are the Decemberists with "All I Want Is You."
title: Saturday Sessions: The Decemberists perform "All I Want Is You"

description: Formula 1 racing is growing in popularity, with three Grand Prix races held in the United States. Now, the motorsport is expanding its reach to female drivers with a junior-level series that paves the way for women to reach the top of the sport. Dana Jacobson has more.
title: Formula racing is growing in popularity and expanding to female drivers

description: For nearly 25 years, the Decemberists have captured listeners with their unique, highly stylized songs. Now, the group is out with their first album in six years and preparing for a world tour. From their new album "As It Ever Was, So It Will Be Again," here are the Decemberists with "Long White Veil."
title: Saturday Sessions: The Decemberists perform "Long White Veil"

description: The Decemberists have been around for nearly a quarter century and just released their first new album in six years. The album is full of surprises - including a 19-minute song. Jeff Glor sat down with lead singer and songwriter Colin Meloy to talk more about the album and the long-running group as they prepare for a world tour.
title: The Decemberists' lead singer talks new album and upcoming world tour

description: The British royals joined thousands of fans at Wembley Stadium during the first night of the Eras Tour stop in London.
title: Prince William, George and Charlotte attend Taylor Swift concert

description: More than 100 million people remain under excessive heat warnings and advisories this weekend as an intense and dangerous heat wave brings searing temperatures across the country. The weather has already set records from the Midwest to the mid-Atlantic, and more is on the way.
title: Dangerous heat wave brings scorching temperatures across the country

description: Join Chef Luke Farrell on a journey from the streets of London to the English countryside to celebrate the flavors of Thailand. Farrell, an acclaimed chef, has made his name bringing Thai food to London.
title: Meet the chef bringing a taste of authentic Thai food to England

description: Ray Kurzweil is an acclaimed inventor, futurist and author. In his newest book, "The Singularity is Nearer," he dives into the future date where humans and machines eventually merge. Jeff Glor has more from their conversation.
title: Inventor and futurist talks his hopes for the advancement of AI and technology

description: Millions of Americans – particularly those in the highly populated Interstate 95 corridor are under heat-related advisories or alerts as the squelching heat is expected to hit record-breaking temperatures in some areas.
title: Scorching temperatures persist as heat wave expands for millions in U.S.

description: In its eighth major attack on energy facilities overnight, Russia fired 16 missiles and 13 Shahed drones, the Ukrainian air force said.
title: Russia targets Ukrainian energy facilities with new barrage of missiles

description: The Supreme Court made a major Second Amendment ruling on Friday with an 8-1 decision to uphold a federal law that disarms domestic abusers. The court ruled that the government can take firearms away from people who are under domestic violence restraining orders.
title: Supreme Court upholds federal law that disarms domestic abusers

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals,  Adriane Kiss shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: At least three people were killed and 10 others injured when a man opened fire at a grocery store in Arkansas. Meanwhile, an American citizen has returned home from months in Turks and Caicos after bullets were found in his bag. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Three killed in shooting at Arkansas grocery store

description: They had gone to the temple seeking shelter, as it was on higher ground, but the building was toppled by a landslide, killing the family.
title: Family of 6 dead found dead by rescuers after landslide in eastern China

description: J.J. Machnik went into sudden cardiac arrest because of a genetic heart disorder that affects 1 in 500 people: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
title: A teenager collapsed. His friends' quick response saved his life.

description: Morley Safer profiled actress Meryl Streep for 60 Minutes in 2011. Safer spoke with Streep about her many acting roles, which have ranged from Margaret Thatcher to Julia Child.
title: Meryl Streep: "The Many Meryls" | 60 Minutes Archive

description: "Because after putting us in sh*t it's up to them to bathe in our sh*t," a website for the protest says.
title: Parisians threaten to poop in the Seine to protest pollution ahead of Olympics

description: Wild Thang, an 8-year-old Pekingese from Oregon, beat seven other competitors to gain the title world's ugliest dog at the Sonoma-Marin Fair on Friday.
title: Wild Thang wins world's ugliest dog contest in Petaluma

description: 3 killed, 10 wounded in shooting outside Arkansas grocery store; Young family finds happiness on remote island off Maine
title: 6/21: CBS Evening News

description: Last weekend, two USDA employees were assaulted and temporarily held by assailants in the Mexican state of Michoacan.
title: U.S. to resume avocado inspections in Mexican state that were halted by violence

description: The parties said the settlement was the first between a state government and youth plaintiffs to address constitutional issues arising from climate change.
title: Hawaii reaches settlement with youth who sued over climate change

description: Lana Zak reports on a mass shooting in Arkansas that left three people dead, the Supreme Court upholding a law that prohibits domestic abusers from owning guns, and why Americans are falling behind when it comes it comes to taking vacations.
title: 6/21: CBS News Weekender

description: NASA plans to hold a formal re-entry readiness review before setting a new landing target date.
title: NASA again delays Boeing Starliner capsule's return to Earth

description: Isle au Haut, Maine, has a population of about 50 people. Its only businesses are a gift shop and a general store.
title: Why a young family decided to move to a tiny Maine island

description: Here are some of the top headlines for Friday, including deadly rip currents in Florida, a scary scene in Oklahoma City as a Southwest Airlines flight flew unusually low over houses on its approach, and record-breaking travel as summer officially kicks off. Manny Bojorquez, Carter Evans and Kris Van Cleave have more.
title: Deadly rip currents, and other top headlines

description: More than 112 million Americans are under excessive heat warnings and advisories, from Los Angeles to New York. CBS News correspondent Lilia Luciano has more.
title: Relentless heat continues with over 100 million under warnings

description: CBS Philadelphia chief meteorologist Bill Kelly has a look at where the heat is headed this weekend and how long it's expected to stick around.
title: How long is the heat expected to stick around?
